title: Define System Requirements
description: Outline the specific needs of the RealTimeAnomalyDetectionSystem, including data types, throughput requirements, accuracy expectations, and any other essential system characteristics.

title: Design Distributed Statistical Analysis Model
description: Create a design for the statistical model used to detect anomalies in real-time. This design should account for multiple data streams and high throughput.

title: Choose Machine Learning Algorithms
description: Research and select appropriate machine learning algorithms that can effectively detect anomalies in real-time for the chosen statistical model.

title: Develop Real-Time Data Stream Processing Layer
description: Create a layer that can handle and process multiple real-time data streams for anomaly detection.

title: Implement Machine Learning Models
description: Integrate the chosen machine learning algorithms into the developed data stream processing layer.
dependencies: Develop Real-Time Data Stream Processing Layer

title: Create User Interface for System Monitoring
description: Design and implement a user interface that allows administrators to monitor the system's performance, data streams, and anomaly detections in real-time.

title: Test System Functionality and Performance
description: Conduct thorough testing of the RealTimeAnomalyDetectionSystem to ensure its functionality, performance, and scalability under various conditions.
dependencies: Create User Interface for System Monitoring

title: Optimize System Performance and Resource Usage
description: Analyze and optimize the performance and resource usage of the RealTimeAnomalyDetectionSystem to improve efficiency and scalability.

title: Secure the RealTimeAnomalyDetectionSystem
description: Implement security measures to protect the system from potential threats, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality.

title: Document the RealTimeAnomalyDetectionSystem
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the system, including installation, configuration, usage, maintenance, and troubleshooting guides. The documentation should be well-structured, easy to navigate, with clear examples and step-by-step instructions. Additionally, consider providing explanations of key concepts, use cases, and potential pitfalls.
